metadata.description: 100 curated claims for LLM fact-checking evaluation

claims.text: Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius at sea level.
claims.notes: Basic physics fact

claims.text: The Great Wall of China is visible from space with the naked eye.
claims.notes: Common myth - debunked by astronauts

claims.text: Humans only use 10% of their brain.
claims.notes: Popular myth - brain imaging shows all regions active

claims.text: The Earth is approximately 4.5 billion years old.
claims.notes: Scientific consensus

claims.text: Vaccines cause autism.
claims.notes: Thoroughly debunked - original study retracted

claims.text: Einstein failed math in school.
claims.notes: Common myth - he excelled in math

claims.text: Goldfish have a memory span of only 3 seconds.
claims.notes: Myth - goldfish can remember for months

claims.text: Lightning never strikes the same place twice.
claims.notes: Myth - tall structures are struck repeatedly

claims.text: The human body contains about 206 bones in adulthood.
claims.notes: Standard anatomy

claims.text: Mount Everest is the tallest mountain on Earth.
claims.notes: True for height above sea level (8,849m)

claims.text: Antibiotics are effective against viral infections.
claims.notes: Antibiotics only work against bacteria

claims.text: The speed of light is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second.
claims.notes: Physics constant

claims.text: Cracking your knuckles causes arthritis.
claims.notes: Multiple studies show no connection

claims.text: The Amazon rainforest produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
claims.notes: Edge case - technically misleading, net oxygen contribution is near zero

claims.text: Napoleon Bonaparte was unusually short for his time.
claims.notes: He was 5'7" - average for the era

claims.text: The Declaration of Independence was signed on July 4, 1776.
claims.notes: Edge case - most signatures were August 2, 1776

claims.text: Bats are blind.
claims.notes: Bats can see - they also use echolocation

claims.text: The Sahara Desert is the largest desert on Earth.
claims.notes: Antarctica is larger (it's a cold desert)

claims.text: DNA was first discovered in 1953 by Watson and Crick.
claims.notes: DNA discovered 1869 by Miescher; Watson/Crick found structure

claims.text: The Moon has no gravity.
claims.notes: Moon has about 1/6 Earth's gravity

claims.text: Sugar causes hyperactivity in children.
claims.notes: Multiple studies show no causal link

claims.text: The human heart is located on the left side of the chest.
claims.notes: Edge case - heart is mostly centered, slightly left

claims.text: Birds are descendants of dinosaurs.
claims.notes: Scientific consensus - birds are living dinosaurs

claims.text: The tongue has specific zones for different tastes.
claims.notes: Tongue map is a myth - all areas sense all tastes

claims.text: Venus is the hottest planet in our solar system.
claims.notes: Despite not being closest to Sun - greenhouse effect

claims.text: The flu vaccine can give you the flu.
claims.notes: Inactivated vaccines cannot cause infection

claims.text: Christopher Columbus discovered America.
claims.notes: Vikings arrived earlier; Indigenous peoples were there first

claims.text: Chameleons change color to blend with their surroundings.
claims.notes: Color change is mainly for temperature/communication

claims.text: The Pythagorean theorem states that a² + b² = c² for right triangles.
claims.notes: Mathematical theorem

claims.text: George Washington had wooden teeth.
claims.notes: His dentures were made of ivory, metal, and human teeth

claims.text: Drinking 8 glasses of water a day is scientifically necessary for health.
claims.notes: No scientific basis - needs vary by individual

claims.text: The Berlin Wall fell in 1989.
claims.notes: November 9, 1989

claims.text: Bulls are angered by the color red.
claims.notes: Bulls are colorblind to red - react to movement

claims.text: Pluto is classified as a planet.
claims.notes: Reclassified as dwarf planet in 2006

claims.text: Reading in dim light permanently damages your eyes.
claims.notes: May cause temporary strain, not permanent damage

claims.text: The Titanic was described as 'unsinkable' before it sank.
claims.notes: True - widely promoted as unsinkable

claims.text: Hair and fingernails continue to grow after death.
claims.notes: Skin dehydrates making them appear longer

claims.text: The Mona Lisa was stolen from the Louvre in 1911.
claims.notes: Stolen by Vincenzo Peruggia, recovered in 1913

claims.text: Shaving makes hair grow back thicker.
claims.notes: Blunt edge gives appearance of thickness

claims.text: The sun is a star.
claims.notes: G-type main-sequence star

claims.text: Humans evolved from chimpanzees.
claims.notes: Humans and chimps share a common ancestor

claims.text: 5G networks spread COVID-19.
claims.notes: Conspiracy theory with no scientific basis

claims.text: The Earth is flat.
claims.notes: Earth is an oblate spheroid

claims.text: Climate change is primarily caused by human activities.
claims.notes: Scientific consensus (97%+ of climate scientists)

claims.text: The Wright Brothers made the first powered flight in 1903.
claims.notes: December 17, 1903 at Kitty Hawk

claims.text: You can see the curvature of the Earth from a commercial airplane.
claims.notes: Visible at cruising altitude (35,000+ ft) with wide view

claims.text: Eating carrots significantly improves night vision.
claims.notes: WWII propaganda - only helps if vitamin A deficient

claims.text: The Hawaiian Islands are moving northwest.
claims.notes: Pacific Plate moves ~7cm per year

claims.text: Iron Maiden was a common medieval torture device.
claims.notes: Likely 19th century invention, no medieval evidence

claims.text: Organic food is nutritionally superior to conventional food.
claims.notes: Studies show minimal nutritional difference

claims.text: The speed of sound is faster than the speed of light.
claims.notes: Light is approximately 881,000 times faster

claims.text: The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during summer.
claims.notes: Thermal expansion of iron

claims.text: Detox diets remove toxins that the body cannot eliminate naturally.
claims.notes: Liver and kidneys already handle detoxification

claims.text: The first computer programmer was a woman named Ada Lovelace.
claims.notes: Wrote algorithms for Babbage's Analytical Engine

claims.text: Alcohol kills brain cells.
claims.notes: Damages dendrites but doesn't kill cells directly

claims.text: The Electoral College determines the US President.
claims.notes: Constitutional process for presidential election

claims.text: We swallow an average of 8 spiders per year while sleeping.
claims.notes: Made-up statistic, no scientific basis

claims.text: Diamonds are made of compressed coal.
claims.notes: Both carbon, but diamonds form much deeper

claims.text: The US Constitution explicitly mentions separation of church and state.
claims.notes: Phrase from Jefferson's letter, not Constitution itself

claims.text: Bananas grow on trees.
claims.notes: Banana plants are herbaceous, not trees

claims.text: The COVID-19 vaccines were developed in under a year.
claims.notes: mRNA vaccines authorized December 2020

claims.text: Glass is a liquid that flows slowly over time.
claims.notes: Glass is an amorphous solid, not a slow-flowing liquid

claims.text: The Supreme Court has always had nine justices.
claims.notes: Started with 6, varied from 5-10 historically

claims.text: Saturn's rings are solid structures.
claims.notes: Made of ice and rock particles

claims.text: GMO foods are unsafe for human consumption.
claims.notes: Scientific consensus: GMOs are safe

claims.text: The Second Amendment protects individual gun ownership.
claims.notes: Per DC v. Heller (2008) interpretation

claims.text: Lemmings commit mass suicide by jumping off cliffs.
claims.notes: Myth perpetuated by Disney documentary manipulation

claims.text: The First Amendment protects speech from private censorship.
claims.notes: Only restricts government, not private entities

claims.text: Ostriches bury their heads in the sand when frightened.
claims.notes: They lie flat or run; head-burying is a myth

claims.text: The US national debt exceeds $30 trillion.
claims.notes: Surpassed $30T in 2022, continues to grow

claims.text: Touching a baby bird will cause its mother to reject it.
claims.notes: Birds have poor sense of smell, will not reject

claims.text: The Affordable Care Act (Obamacare) was ruled unconstitutional.
claims.notes: Upheld by SCOTUS in 2012, individual mandate penalty removed

claims.text: Different parts of the tongue taste different flavors.
claims.notes: Tongue map myth - all areas taste all flavors

claims.text: The US President can declare war without Congressional approval.
claims.notes: Constitution grants war power to Congress (with nuances)

claims.text: Vitamin C cures the common cold.
claims.notes: May slightly reduce duration, does not cure

claims.text: The Federal Reserve is part of the federal government.
claims.notes: Independent agency, quasi-governmental structure

claims.text: Caffeine stunts growth in children.
claims.notes: No scientific evidence supports this claim

claims.text: Members of Congress are exempt from insider trading laws.
claims.notes: STOCK Act of 2012 made them subject to these laws

claims.text: The full Moon affects human behavior.
claims.notes: Studies consistently show no lunar effect

claims.text: Citizens United v. FEC allowed unlimited corporate campaign spending.
claims.notes: 2010 decision enabled super PACs

claims.text: Honey never spoils.
claims.notes: Archaeologists found edible honey in Egyptian tombs

claims.text: A filibuster requires continuous speaking in the US Senate.
claims.notes: Modern filibuster just requires threat, no speaking needed

claims.text: Microwave ovens cook food from the inside out.
claims.notes: Microwaves penetrate but don't start from center

claims.text: The 2020 US presidential election had widespread fraud that changed the outcome.
claims.notes: 60+ court cases found no evidence of outcome-changing fraud

claims.text: Humans and dinosaurs coexisted.
claims.notes: Dinosaurs extinct ~65 million years before humans

claims.text: The Electoral College can be abolished by a simple majority vote.
claims.notes: Requires constitutional amendment (2/3 + 3/4 states)

claims.text: An octopus has three hearts.
claims.notes: Two branchial hearts and one systemic heart

claims.text: Ranked choice voting is used in US federal elections nationwide.
claims.notes: Only some states/localities use it as of 2026

claims.text: Black holes are actually visible as black objects in space.
claims.notes: Cannot be seen directly - detected by effects on surroundings

claims.text: The Vice President can unilaterally reject electoral votes.
claims.notes: Ceremonial role only - cannot reject valid votes

claims.text: Humans have five senses.
claims.notes: Edge case - humans have additional senses (balance, proprioception, etc.)

claims.text: The national popular vote determines the US President.
claims.notes: Electoral College determines president, not popular vote

claims.text: A penny dropped from the Empire State Building can kill someone.
claims.notes: Terminal velocity too low to be lethal

claims.text: Ivermectin is FDA-approved for treating COVID-19 in humans.
claims.notes: Approved for parasites, not COVID-19 (as of data cutoff)

claims.text: The sun revolves around the Earth.
claims.notes: Earth revolves around the sun

claims.text: Hydroxychloroquine is an effective treatment for COVID-19.
claims.notes: Large trials showed no benefit for COVID-19

claims.text: Bananas are berries but strawberries are not.
claims.notes: Botanical definition - bananas are true berries

claims.text: The blood in your veins is blue until it reaches oxygen.
claims.notes: Blood is always red; veins appear blue through skin

claims.text: Cleopatra lived closer in time to the Moon landing than to the construction of the Great Pyramid.
claims.notes: Pyramid ~2560 BC, Cleopatra ~30 BC, Moon 1969 AD

claims.text: Muscle turns into fat if you stop exercising.
claims.notes: Muscle and fat are different tissues - cannot convert
